resources.string: Pune is known as the Oxford of the East. It is one of the largest growing cities in India…
Pawna Lake is an artificial reservoir formed by water of its namesake dam. Situated towards the outskirts of Lonavala, this lake is a popular picnic and leisure spot. It is 63.8 km from Pune.
Mahabaleshwar is the largest and one of the most beautiful hill stations in Maharashtra state. It is situated at an altitude of 1372 m above seal level in Satara district. It is 120.4 km from Pune.

The place gets its name from the times of the British Raj, after the Governor of Bombay, Sir Mount Elphinstone. It is believed to have been founded by Dr. Murray in 1930 and has an old mansion in its vicinity. The mansion now lies in ruins and local authorities are planning to demolish to erect a picnic shed in its place for tourists. The Elphinstone Point offers a panoramic view of the Pratapgad Fort, with the Koyna Valley to one side and the Savitri Valley to the other. It is 125.2 km from Pune.

The event lets the campers explore the forest area around the lovely Bhandardara to catch sights of fireflies in the wild.This happens in Bhandararara in the last week of May. Bhandararara is 172.4 km from Pune.

Sinhagad is a hill fortress located at around 25 km southwest of the city of Pune, India. Previously known as Kondhana, the fort had been the site of many battles, most notably the Battle of Sinhagad in 1670. Some of the information available at this fort suggests that the fort could have been built 2000 years ago.

Lohagad (Iron fort) is one of the many hill forts of Maharashtra state in India. Situated close to the hill station Lonavala and 52 km (32 mi) northwest of Pune, Lohagad rises to an elevation of 1,033 m (3,389 ft) above sea level.
Shaniwarwada is a historical fortification in the city of Pune in Maharashtra, India. Built in 1732, it was the seat of the Peshwas of the Maratha. It is located in Shivajinagar.

The Aga Khan Palace was built by Sultan Muhammed Shah Aga Khan III in Pune, India. Built in 1892, it is one of important landmarks in Indian history. The palace is closely linked to the Indian freedom movement as it served as a prison for Mahatma Gandhi, his wife Kasturba Gandhi, his secretary Mahadev Desai and Sarojini Naidu. It is located in Viman Nagar.
Eighteen degree is famous for its mutli cuisine and services. It has a zomato rating of 4.5/5. It is located in Pimple Saudagar.
Nawab Asia is famous for its Indian cuisine and services. It has a zomato rating of 4.2/5. It is located in Balewadi High Street.
Baashos is famous for its Indian cuisine and services. It has a zomato rating of 4.0/5. It is located in Koregaon Park
Gong is famous for its Continental and chinese cuisine and services. It has a zomato rating of 4.6/5. It is located in Balewadi High Street

Dagdusheth is a 127 year old Ganesh Temple in Pune. The temple is popular in Maharashtra and is visited by thousands of pilgrims every year. The main Ganesh idol is insured for sum of ₹10 million (US$150,000). It is located in Deccan Gymkhana.

The Bahubali Thali is world\'s biggest veg thali served by Aaogi Khaoji, Pune. It is nearly impossible for a person to finish the thali all alone by himself/herself. However,if you manage to do so,you will be served free food for lifetime there! It is located near Ambedkar Chowk.
Pashan lake is an artificial lake home to many beautiful birds. It is one of the most serene places in the city of Pune. It is located in Pashan.
The visit to Pune is incomplete without visiting this famous iranian cafe and trying it\'s Bun Maska with Chai. It is located in Deccan Gymkhana.
